violations.excerpt: name does not meet format requirements

discussion.author: BTV25
discussion.text: I would like to request an exception for the name used for this package. It was developed by the BYU FLOW Lab and is a Vortex Particle Method (VPM), hence the name.

discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text: [noblock] Seems okay to me: If this package had used the capitalization `FlowVPM`, it would have passed automerge without any problems. I don't believe artificially enforcing a particular capitalization that would otherwise be okay is something we should do. Unfortunately, the rule against all-caps can only be overridden by a full registry maintainer, so at the end of the three-day waiting period, you'll have to ask for a manual merge on Slack

discussion.author: cibinjoseph
discussion.text:
@DilumAluthge 
Hi, I'd like to confirm keeping the package name as "FLOWVPM" for registration since it relates to the lab name and solver acronyms.

discussion.author: EdoAlvarezR
discussion.text: Hi, thanks for the guidance! As @BTV25 mentioned above, FLOWVPM gets it's name from being a **V**ortex **P**article **M**ethod (VPM) code developed at the **FL**ight, **O**ptimization, and **W**ind Lab (FLOW Lab) at BYU.

discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text: You should probably direct these confirmations @DilumAluthge (here or in the [Slack thread](https://julialang.slack.com/archives/C6M4DQA5P/p1757018833996699))

discussion.author: DilumAluthge
discussion.text:
Thanks all. To summarize, we've asked the package author to consider a different package name, and the package author is insisting on keeping this name. For this specific case, because the author insists on keeping this name, I will manually merge the registration.

---

Note to others that may find this comment in the future: A package author insisting on keeping the name does not guarantee or ensure that they will get that name. Each registration is evaluated on a case by case basis. Additionally, the standards for the General registry continue to evolve over time. Package names similar to those that were merged in the past may be rejected in the future.
